revised_title: Observations on the Sleep and Vigiliae of Plants
tldr: The author, Richard Pultney, discusses the phenomenon of plants "sleeping" or closing their leaves and flowers at certain times, a concept first observed by Carl Linnaeus. Pultney provides a detailed account of several plants that exhibit this behavior, including the Trifolium pratense album, and notes that this may be related to the process of pollination. He also highlights the importance of further research on this topic to understand the underlying mechanisms and potential applications in botany.
